definition: to study attentively (a book)/to delve into
to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]

sentences.english: Someday, he hopes to continue his studies at Harvard University .
sentences.chinese: 他希望會有那麼一天可以在哈佛大學繼續研讀。

sentences.english: You can not agree to the contract until you make a brief perusal.
sentences.chinese: 只有當你簡短地研讀過之，你才能同意這項合約。

sentences.english: Peruse other job ads from the same employer.
sentences.chinese: 研讀同一個僱主的其他招聘廣告。

sentences.english: This guy had read up on XP and was pretty much in favor of it.
sentences.chinese: 那個傢伙研讀過極限編程，並且對之很贊同。

sentences.english: Theater students reading a script are oblivious to a mangy dog searching for his dinner.
sentences.chinese: 同學研讀劇本，癩痢狗穿梭覓食，互不干擾。

sentences.english: Everybody should grind carefully seriously read, make clear each concept and formula.
sentences.chinese: 大家要仔細認真研讀，弄清每一個概念和公式。

sentences.english: I pored over primary and secondary literature.
sentences.chinese: 我認真研讀了原始文獻和二手資料。

sentences.english: Really speaking it is one of the best reference book for studying the Ye's case.
sentences.chinese: 且語言通俗，條理分明，誠爲研讀葉案較好的參考書。

sentences.english: I really must get down to reading the book.
sentences.chinese: 我真得安下心來好好研讀這本書了。

sentences.english: Scott is now boning up on mathematics and physics for the coming examinations.
sentences.chinese: 司各特現在正爲即將來臨的考試努力研讀數學和物理。

sentences.english: Together Jesus and Barata read the Jewish Psalms and Prophets; read the Vedas, the Avesta and the wisdom of Gautama.
sentences.chinese: 巴爾陀教耶穌研讀韋陀經，和佛陀的大智慧結晶。

sentences.english: Well, that was also my question when I first started studying Ling Shu .
sentences.chinese: 其實，這也是我剛剛開始研讀靈樞時的問題。

sentences.english: Get yourself a formatting book and read it over-and-over again.
sentences.chinese: 自己找一本格式編排的書，然後反覆研讀。

sentences.english: All that we do every day is study.
sentences.chinese: 我們每天做的只是研讀。

sentences.english: Then, teach your children to study the Bible for themselves.
sentences.chinese: 緊跟着，教導你的孩子們自己研讀聖經。

definition: to expound (a position)/to elaborate (on a topic)/to treat (a subject)
to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]
to prove a point/to expound on/to demonstrate or prove (through argument)/proof
to elucidate/to expound/to study and explain
